Description: Egyptian terracotta model sword; repaired; pommel lost. A model of a sheathed sword, with a ribbed handle with the pommel broken away, the guard of truncated pedimental form, enclosing a six-pointed rosette in relief; the lower moulding has diagonal transverse grooves.. The scabbard is plain except for an upper moulding: there may be some decoration at its tip, but it’s not clear. The back is plain except for a jog defining the scabbard. Hollow, from two-piece mould. Brown Nile silt with abundant fine gold mica and small white inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Town (Naukratis), Site 95 (Petrie), the terracotta workshop, at the eastern edge of the town
Curator's comments: Very similar to BM1886,0401.1538, also from, Naukratis from the terracotta workshop. Probably locally made. Parallel found in the Fayum, now in Cairo Museum (TR6/3/36/1=SR5/1134).
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3292)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DF.06) (Phase 1)
